a conference last month, said there "has been this nervousness, partly as a result of listening to political consultants... that you can't seem to be threatening voters" about voting for taxes. There's this worry about the optics of all that. I understand that- voters don't want to be threatened, and voters shouldn't be threatened, Bill Lockyer said. "However, you also have to be honest with them about what the consequences will be if the only policy option is an all-cut budget. And no one has yet produced that."

State of the Union address to propose cuts in Social Security. "I hope that information is wrong and that you will stand by your campaign promises to strengthen Social Security," read the letter from Sen. Bernie Sanders . I urge you once again to make it clear to the American people that under your watch we will not cut Social Security benefits, raise the retirement age or privatize this critical program. The message is being echoed by labor unions, senior groups and religious organizations as the State of the Union Address approaches. especially Sergey Brin , who was born in the Soviet Union, did not want to kowtow to a repressive regime, while Eric Schmidt was more willing to accommodate Chinese demands that Google censor its search results in that country. One of the issues that precipitated this change[ of the CEO] was what happened in China. But China is not the cause-it's symptomatic of the broader disconnect between the way that Eric Schmidt wanted to run Google and the way the founders wanted to run the company, says David Wolf, chief executive of Wolf Group Asia, a Beijing-based marketing-strategy firm. Donald Rumsfeld , who personally authorized harsh interrogation techniques used on some terrorism suspects, said he had not considered whether he, too, might face prosecution if he travelled abroad. And I think she really hadn't anticipated those kinds of questions, so I think it might've thrown her off a bit. And then we got into foreign policy- because, after all, she was at the UN meeting with world leaders- and clearly she was struggling with some of those answers. said he has spoken to Eagles quarterback Michael Vick several times in the past few weeks. Michael Vick was reinstated during the 2009 season after spending 18 months in prison on federal charges of running a dogfighting ring. He's paid a very significant price and he's doing the right thing, Roger Goodell said. "I don't want him to put himself in a position where bad things can happen around him. He takes that seriously.
